answers.answer: I don't feel this is related to your sugar levels.  Contact your doctor regarding this.  It can be anything from anxiety to a circulation problem.  Good luck and take care.

What is your diabetes history? How do you know your sugar is spiking high and low - are you self monitoring with a home glucose test meter? If you have had uncontrolled/unmanaged diabetes for a period of time your numbness could be caused by onset of Neuropathy, Neurothapy will lead to amputation. Go see a doctor asap. If you cannot afford one Google "free health clinics" in your area.

question: i think my sugar is spiking high and low . and i have problems with my legs and hands going numb is there anything u can tell me?
title: sugar and numbness
